ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:0.2_0: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:0.5_0: 44. The training rule on providing services for householders
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.2_0: the nuns were providing services for householders.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.3_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized Thullanandā,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.4_0: “How can nuns provide services for householders?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.5_0: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.9_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.10_0: the Buddha said, “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.11.1_0: ‘If a nun provides services for a householder, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.1.4_0: ... The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.1.6_0: if she cooks rice porridge, a meal, or non-staple food for a householder, or she washes a wrap garment or a turban for them, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.2.3_0: if it is a meal for the Sangha;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.2.4_0: if it is to venerate a shrine;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.2.5_0: if she cooks rice porridge, a meal, or non-staple food for her own service-provider, or she washes a wrap garment or a turban for them;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.2.7_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.2.8_0: The fourth rule, the training rule on fire, is finished.
